name: [BF]  2D String Transpose
description:
## Task

Given a null-terminated string of multiple lines of text, where each line is ended by a newline character `'\n'`, transpose the lines so that each character at position `(row, column)` in the original string ends up at position `(column, row)` in the transposed string.

You can imagine that the string `"123\n456\n\0"` is equivalent to the matrix `$\begin{bmatrix} \text{1 2 3}\\ \text{4 5 6}\\ \end{bmatrix}$`.


## Examples
```
        Input          |        Output
---------------------- | --------------------
  "abc\ndef\nghi\n\0" --> "adg\nbeh\ncfi\n"
       "123\n456\n\0" --> "14\n25\n36\n"
           "1\n2\n\0" --> "12\n"
             "12\n\0" --> "1\n2\n"
              "0\n\0" --> "0\n"
```

## Constraints

- Matrix elements consist of alphanumeric characters only.
- `$ 1 \leq \text{column width, row height} \leq 15 $`
- Invalid cases such as jagged arrays will not be tested.


---

GLHF!
